intro: Pterygodium inversum, commonly known as the inverted pterygodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and it produces small, yellowish flowers. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
